businessProfile.name: Leona's Pizzeria - Irving Park
businessProfile.address: 4363 W Irving Park Rd, Chicago, IL 60641, USA
businessProfile.formatted_address: 4363 W Irving Park Rd, Chicago, IL 60641, USA

reviews.text:
The Old Irving Park Leona's location took over the Tahina Kitchen space. Shifting from an incredible Middle Eastern, quality food and service restaurant, to a sub-par pizza place, absolutely Unworthy of the long standing Leona's name and reputation. Overall experience: Horrible. I just raised my cholesterol numbers for REALLY BAD food.

I was very hopeful for the new Old Irving Park location, as I grew up eating at various Leona's in Chicago. I placed an order today as a treat for myself and a break from my healthy eating pattern.  Before I could do so, a pop up for "Club Rewards" popped up, so I entered my phone number and immediately saw a "Free Cheese Pizza" for signing up. However,  when I picked up my order from the rude guy behind the register, I showed him the pop up and explained I tried to enter the code and it wouldn't work. He quickly said "we aren't doing that anymore, too many people kept clicking on it..." I told him they needed to take it off their website, as that is false advertising. He did not respond.  Not "I'm  sorry about that," or "I'll let my boss know." No response, he just stood there staring at me.

I ordered the Italian Beef Egg Rolls and Brick Mozzarella Sticks. The Brick Mozzarella sticks were incredible growing up, the ones I got today, were inedible. The batter used for the outside reminded me of a hard, tasteless, corn flake. I have no idea what they are using now, but the outside of the Mozzarella Brick was bizarre, the texture was really unpleasant, I'm surprised I didn't chip a tooth. The Italian Beef Egg Rolls (2 in the order what??) Were also unpleasant as one of them was burned. Flavor was lacking.

Other reviewers have also had similar experiences here. My guess is this Leona's location won't last long. Its too bad, they used to have good food and service. I won't be going back.

Average. Wasn't expecting much so I wasn't too disappointed. My main disappointment was for the pizza toppings. Did a thin half/half and toppings for half the pizza costs the same as the whole pizza. You'd think that meant they would do a lot more topping but no, it's the average amount of toppings. What was NOT average was the pathetic amount of spinach I got in my stuffed pizza. There was almost nothing in there.

Food was absolutely amazing and loyal to the original Leona‚Äòs menu down to the psychedelic salad!  The wedge fries were hot and perfectly seasoned. Dipping them in the creamy garlic dressing took us back to the old days. The meatball sandwich was just as I remember!

Kathy, the owner came out and greeted us and gave us a little history of the Leona‚Äòs family of restaurants. Great fresh food just like we remember.

We will definitely be back with our family!

Leona's makes us feel at home - whether in the restaurant or catering one of my events. Love the service, and extra touches. The food is always delicious and tastes home made. My clients, family, and friends all appreciate when I take them to Leona's. Thanks for making us feel at home with an amazing atmosphere and variety of dishes.

Very Very crappy presentation on the pizza arrived cold. The portion of calamari is you can see is small. The ringlets are dried out. There is no quality to this food at all. I really don't think anybody should ever go there. This is such a poor showing on this restaurant that had a history, but no longer has. The people answering the phone are rude worthless scum.  There are much better pizza places in the area like chicago pizza. La villa and others.  The rating they were getting. The rating For this restaurant is way blown out of proportion. These restaurants should be reviewed, so they show a current level of rating. I posted 2 photos of their crappy food quality.  They will continue to be posted. That is a $20 calamari in photo. Being pissed off after spending money on this garbage.

editorial_summary.overview: Old-school local chain offering homestyle Italian & American standards & a kids' menu.

recentReviews.text: Great pizza friendly staff, close to my home, will definitely be going back.

Average. Wasn't expecting much so I wasn't too disappointed. My main disappointment was for the pizza toppings. Did a thin half/half and toppings for half the pizza costs the same as the whole pizza. You'd think that meant they would do a lot more topping but no, it's the average amount of toppings. What was NOT average was the pathetic amount of spinach I got in my stuffed pizza. There was almost nothing in there.

I would not recommend. I ordered a fish plater and It so fishy tasting to the point where I couldn‚Äôt even swallow it let alone finish the food I payed for. Everything else was tasteless and my garlic bread was stale. The service was sub par. I called and emailed for assistance to no response. Food and service was less than good.
Excellent customer service, pizza is delicious. Good to see Leona's in the neighborhood. Definitely recommend.

Happy 4th. We had a random day planned and didn't account for dinner. We stopped at Leona's on Irving without thinking it was 7pm on the 4th. They were closing but didn't want us to leave empty handed and gave us this incredible Sicilian style pizza. We tried to pay but they insisted we just enjoy the pizza and the 4th. We had been in a couple times for Italian Ice and gelato (amazing) and noted how friendly and engaged the staff was each time. This was just another example of their way of doing business.

They have a big menu for takeout including pizza by the slice. Walk over for dessert or order dinner for the family. What a wonderful addition to the neighborhood

Food was absolutely amazing and loyal to the original Leona‚Äòs menu down to the psychedelic salad!  The wedge fries were hot and perfectly seasoned. Dipping them in the creamy garlic dressing took us back to the old days. The meatball sandwich was just as I remember!

Kathy, the owner came out and greeted us and gave us a little history of the Leona‚Äòs family of restaurants. Great fresh food just like we remember.

We will definitely be back with our family!

Other reviewers have also had similar experiences here. My guess is this Leona's location won't last long. Its too bad, they used to have good food and service. I won't be going back.

detailedReviews.author: SHERRY MARKS
detailedReviews.text: Great pizza friendly staff, close to my home, will definitely be going back.

detailedReviews.author: Doe
detailedReviews.text: Average. Wasn't expecting much so I wasn't too disappointed. My main disappointment was for the pizza toppings. Did a thin half/half and toppings for half the pizza costs the same as the whole pizza. You'd think that meant they would do a lot more topping but no, it's the average amount of toppings. What was NOT average was the pathetic amount of spinach I got in my stuffed pizza. There was almost nothing in there.

detailedReviews.author: Maya Papaya
detailedReviews.text: I would not recommend. I ordered a fish plater and It so fishy tasting to the point where I couldn‚Äôt even swallow it let alone finish the food I payed for. Everything else was tasteless and my garlic bread was stale. The service was sub par. I called and emailed for assistance to no response. Food and service was less than good.

detailedReviews.author: Wilfredo Rivera Jr
detailedReviews.text: Excellent customer service, pizza is delicious. Good to see Leona's in the neighborhood. Definitely recommend.

detailedReviews.author: Peter Barash
detailedReviews.text:
Happy 4th. We had a random day planned and didn't account for dinner. We stopped at Leona's on Irving without thinking it was 7pm on the 4th. They were closing but didn't want us to leave empty handed and gave us this incredible Sicilian style pizza. We tried to pay but they insisted we just enjoy the pizza and the 4th. We had been in a couple times for Italian Ice and gelato (amazing) and noted how friendly and engaged the staff was each time. This was just another example of their way of doing business.

They have a big menu for takeout including pizza by the slice. Walk over for dessert or order dinner for the family. What a wonderful addition to the neighborhood

detailedReviews.text:
Food was absolutely amazing and loyal to the original Leona‚Äòs menu down to the psychedelic salad!  The wedge fries were hot and perfectly seasoned. Dipping them in the creamy garlic dressing took us back to the old days. The meatball sandwich was just as I remember!

Kathy, the owner came out and greeted us and gave us a little history of the Leona‚Äòs family of restaurants. Great fresh food just like we remember.

We will definitely be back with our family!

detailedReviews.author: Eva Gelfand
detailedReviews.text:
The Old Irving Park Leona's location took over the Tahina Kitchen space. Shifting from an incredible Middle Eastern, quality food and service restaurant, to a sub-par pizza place, absolutely Unworthy of the long standing Leona's name and reputation. Overall experience: Horrible. I just raised my cholesterol numbers for REALLY BAD food.

I was very hopeful for the new Old Irving Park location, as I grew up eating at various Leona's in Chicago. I placed an order today as a treat for myself and a break from my healthy eating pattern.  Before I could do so, a pop up for "Club Rewards" popped up, so I entered my phone number and immediately saw a "Free Cheese Pizza" for signing up. However,  when I picked up my order from the rude guy behind the register, I showed him the pop up and explained I tried to enter the code and it wouldn't work. He quickly said "we aren't doing that anymore, too many people kept clicking on it..." I told him they needed to take it off their website, as that is false advertising. He did not respond.  Not "I'm  sorry about that," or "I'll let my boss know." No response, he just stood there staring at me.

I ordered the Italian Beef Egg Rolls and Brick Mozzarella Sticks. The Brick Mozzarella sticks were incredible growing up, the ones I got today, were inedible. The batter used for the outside reminded me of a hard, tasteless, corn flake. I have no idea what they are using now, but the outside of the Mozzarella Brick was bizarre, the texture was really unpleasant, I'm surprised I didn't chip a tooth. The Italian Beef Egg Rolls (2 in the order what??) Were also unpleasant as one of them was burned. Flavor was lacking.

Other reviewers have also had similar experiences here. My guess is this Leona's location won't last long. Its too bad, they used to have good food and service. I won't be going back.

detailedReviews.author: Anonymoose
detailedReviews.text: I think Old Irving needed a quick pizza/pasta place like this. I tried a sausage thin crust, spaghetti with meat sauce, and a Detroit style with pepperoni. Personally, I wouldn‚Äôt order the Detroit style again. The edges were crispy, but it was just okay. The spaghetti and meat sauce were good, but it‚Äôs spaghetti and meat sauce so don‚Äôt expect anything crazy. The winner was the sausage thin crust. It wasn‚Äôt too cheesy, which is what I like, and the crust was a great mix between crispy and easy to chew. The amount of sauce was perfect. Not too little (like some places), but enough to actually taste it. I know some other reviews from here say to avoid toppings, but I thought the sausage was good. I will definitely get the thin crust again.

detailedReviews.author: Guido Medina
detailedReviews.text: Ordered a pizza this past weekend.  Not bad but found it lacking in taste, sauce tasted like it was straight out the can. I also ordered some calamari but unfortunately it was very rubbery and uneatable so I had to throw it away.  Hoping this place gets better as I was a fan of this place.

detailedReviews.author: Yolanda Fuentes
detailedReviews.text: So good!!! Glad we have it closer to us and is more of an express Leona‚Äôs which it‚Äôs awesome the Italian ice yummy!!!! Met the owner and he friendly gave us a little history of how he started and the other locations he has very nice guy =)

detailedReviews.author: Yolanda Webb
detailedReviews.text: The place was clean & quiet. The hostess was on point with our orders & helpful as well. I will be coming back

detailedReviews.author: Jimmy Antonopoulos
detailedReviews.text: Give Leona‚Äôs a try! The food tastes great and they provide a lot of options.

detailedReviews.author: Carla
detailedReviews.text: This is not a Leonas. It's a Romas fast food place. Went there for nothing.

detailedReviews.author: Liliana Cortez
detailedReviews.text: Order a lage pizza half sausage, half cheese and a Order of jumbo wing.  Pizza was delicious and the wings crunchy how I liked them. I will definitely recommend this place. Can't wait to return with my family. Service was great too!

detailedReviews.author: Devin Gomez
detailedReviews.text: Better than little Caesars

detailedReviews.author: James Grier
detailedReviews.text: Sal is very friendly, and keeps the place clean! The pizza is great!

detailedReviews.author: Matthew Roche
detailedReviews.text: They push some weird scam for you to sign up on a text/email list. They say you will get a free pizza but it doesn‚Äôt work. Unpleasant business practices.

detailedReviews.author: Angelina Carrano
detailedReviews.text: The staff were awesome and so nice! Pizza and wings were good

detailedReviews.author: Kristin Sneider
detailedReviews.text: We used Leona‚Äôs to cater our family party last weekend and the food was wonderful.  Everything was ready on time and exactly as we ordered.  Would definitely recommend and use them again!

detailedReviews.author: Megan S
detailedReviews.text: Went to a family party where Leona‚Äôs was catered. Delicious delicious food and was the perfect amount for our big family! Wonderful service, it was the perfect catering lunch!

detailedReviews.author: Justin Winuk
detailedReviews.text: Wow. I‚Äôve never had sandwiches like these before! Very yummy!

detailedReviews.author: Mark Sneider
detailedReviews.text: Great carry out subs!  Better than the big national brands!

detailedReviews.author: D O'Brien
detailedReviews.text: Love Leona's! We ordered 2 trays of 4" sandwiches and they were all delicious! Very fresh and had generous fillings. Highly recommend for anyone thinking of using their catering!

detailedReviews.author: Michael McGrath
detailedReviews.text: I love their food! Great for catering, would recommend.

detailedReviews.author: Julia O'Brien
detailedReviews.text: Great food! So great for catering. The subs were delicious. Loved it and would order again!!

detailedReviews.author: Russell Williams
detailedReviews.text: This is Roma's restaurant serving Leona's pizza. But it's all good.

detailedReviews.author: Arturo Botello
detailedReviews.text: I love this place. They have amazing pizza probably one of my favorite places to get pizza now!

detailedReviews.author: Dave LoSavio
detailedReviews.text: Leona's makes us feel at home - whether in the restaurant or catering one of my events. Love the service, and extra touches. The food is always delicious and tastes home made. My clients, family, and friends all appreciate when I take them to Leona's. Thanks for making us feel at home with an amazing atmosphere and variety of dishes.

detailedReviews.author: Wendy
detailedReviews.text: They catered and it was delightful!

detailedReviews.author: Enza Raineri
detailedReviews.text: Jim Moriarty was great!  Helpful and provided great service.

detailedReviews.author: Daniel Winsauer
detailedReviews.text: Wraps were amazing! We had them for an event and it was wonderfully serviced.

detailedReviews.author: Vasiliki Skliros
detailedReviews.text: Fantastic food! Had That‚Äôs at a corporate event and was blown away with the quality taste was amazing very clean highly recommend!!!!

detailedReviews.author: Nicole Deckert
detailedReviews.text: Service was wonderful!  Warm, friendly and inviting.  Food was excellent!

detailedReviews.author: Scotty Gardner
detailedReviews.text: Thank you Jimmy food was amazing !

detailedReviews.author: Jeorge Holmes
detailedReviews.text: Incredible food for lunch. Salad was delicious, wrapped out of this world. üëç

detailedReviews.author: Fivos
detailedReviews.text: Food was amazing. Thank you!

detailedReviews.author: Lucas Weber
detailedReviews.text: Jimmy catered our lunch today and it was fantastic! I highly recommend using them for your next event!

detailedReviews.author: roc construction
detailedReviews.text: Very impressed with rhe presentation and the food.

detailedReviews.author: Nat√°lya Defreyn Nascimento
detailedReviews.text: Great pizza and great service! Definitely recommend, and I appreciate that they have fresh spinach!

detailedReviews.author: Scott Neill
detailedReviews.text:
I cannot say enough great things about Leona‚Äôs Pizzeria & Restaurant! I placed a huge order for the Super Bowl, and they absolutely nailed it. Everything was delivered hot, fresh, and right on time. The quality of the pizza was top-notch, and you could tell it was made with care.

What truly set this experience apart was the outstanding service. The delivery driver went above and beyond‚Äînot only was he incredibly hospitable, but he also helped me set up the catering order. That level of service is rare and deserves recognition!

If you‚Äôre looking for amazing pizza, appetizers and exceptional customer service, Leona‚Äôs Pizzeria is the place to go. Highly recommend!

detailedReviews.author: Kiran Kaur
detailedReviews.text: Amazing food and service

detailedReviews.author: Evelyn Hernandez
detailedReviews.text: Always good service and food

detailedReviews.author: Matthew Yee
detailedReviews.text: The pizza was good, unfortunately it came in a pile inside the box.

detailedReviews.author: Tia White
detailedReviews.text: Mama Kathy made us the best margarita. I enjoyed birthday dinner tremendously! Best marinera sauce in Chicago.

detailedReviews.author: William Burns
detailedReviews.text: Great service on my deliveries. Fast and always hot.

detailedReviews.author: Bruce F
detailedReviews.text: If you want a great Chicago style thin crust, look no further!  Fresh homemade spices and toppings, on a real Chicago thin crust!  The owners here really want you to have a great meal, and even better experience!  Ask to talk to one of them!  Awesome family owned restaurant!  Starting today, this is one of my go tos for pizza night!

detailedReviews.author: Raul Lopez
detailedReviews.text: Ordered a pizza from my favorite pizza place LEONAS on elston av. It was so good and delivery was flawless !

detailedReviews.author: Allen Wright
detailedReviews.text: Just as amazing as it was when I was a kid. If there is any question about who has the best Original Chicago Style pizza‚Ä¶let it be known it‚Äôs Leona‚Äôs!!

detailedReviews.author: Eileen Dimberg
detailedReviews.text:
Went there for lunch today  and not opened inside Why can't this restaurant get it's act together. Change the web site to show correct hours.  They have remodeled the place   The food is good. Maybe if they had some management  that gave a fig  , as it is now won't be around long

.

detailedReviews.author: Anthony Williams
detailedReviews.text: Food is made from scratch. That is a plus. Small and quaint, Tuesday night is trivia nights , not too busy.

detailedReviews.author: Maria Ramos
detailedReviews.text: Great place! We moved away from the area we come back Now a new owner, making great food at Leona's, I loved the secilian pizza, and pasta, please come and try itüëç

detailedReviews.author: Bruce Anderson
detailedReviews.text: Had delivery of the garlic chicken and margarita pesto pizzas. Arrived hot and as promised. Delicious! Amazing crust.

detailedReviews.author: Industry Series DCTorium
detailedReviews.text: Billy and Joe run a great place. Easy service through the QR code, and friendly face to face service. Thin crust was delicious!

detailedReviews.author: Vulture Circle
detailedReviews.text: Great food!

detailedReviews.author: Dan Kriz
detailedReviews.text:
I‚Äôm actually amazed this place is still open.

First, they closed off most of their dining room, which was off putting and a sign they probably don‚Äôt get many dine in guests.

I ordered the Old Irving IPA, which was BROWN.  It should have been a bright orange.  Either that keg has been sitting there for way too long, or they don‚Äôt take care of their beer lines.  My wife got wine, and it was also disgusting.

Then the waiter carried our drinks over in his arms against his sweaty shirt.  Just gross.  That‚Äôs why they should have serving trays.  He also just didn‚Äôt seem to know what this place had to offer, either with food or drinks.

Finally, the pizza just wasn‚Äôt good.  For a pizza place I‚Äôd definitely expect better, especially with all the other options in the area.  It tasted like a ‚ÄúChicago pizza‚Äù we‚Äôd get in Florida.

Overall, it was one of the worst dining experiences I‚Äôve had in the area, and we definitely won‚Äôt be back.

detailedReviews.author: Steven Shepard
detailedReviews.text: Very Very crappy presentation on the pizza arrived cold. The portion of calamari is you can see is small. The ringlets are dried out. There is no quality to this food at all. I really don't think anybody should ever go there. This is such a poor showing on this restaurant that had a history, but no longer has. The people answering the phone are rude worthless scum.  There are much better pizza places in the area like chicago pizza. La villa and others.  The rating they were getting. The rating For this restaurant is way blown out of proportion. These restaurants should be reviewed, so they show a current level of rating. I posted 2 photos of their crappy food quality.  They will continue to be posted. That is a $20 calamari in photo. Being pissed off after spending money on this garbage.

detailedReviews.author: Robert Martin
detailedReviews.text:
Leona's offers a great dining experience with a solid menu of classic Italian-American dishes.

The pizza is a standout, with a crispy crust and generous toppings, while the pasta options are hearty. Service is friendly and efficient, though it can sometimes get busy during peak hours, which may lead to slightly longer wait times. The casual, welcoming atmosphere makes it a perfect spot for a family meal or a laid-back dinner with friends. Overall, a reliable neighborhood choice.

detailedReviews.author: Kelsey Spence
detailedReviews.text: One of my favorite restaurants! They have such delicious food and huge portions‚Ä¶ what‚Äôs not to love?!

detailedReviews.author: N. Flores
detailedReviews.text: Well, I use to love this place pre Pandemic but now they don't even bother to answer the phone!  I've called 3 times today and nobody answered.  It's pizza parlor 101 to answer the phone whenever it rings.  ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

detailedReviews.author: Brian Krumm
detailedReviews.text: Picked up a stupendous catering order this weekend and would highly recommend for parties and private events!

detailedReviews.author: Vicki Ryan
detailedReviews.text: Pizza is sooooo good! Just saying..,,

detailedReviews.author: Alex Aranchuk
detailedReviews.text: Great food for take out (thin crust pizza and rib tips), quick and the price is right

detailedReviews.author: Laura DeLassus
detailedReviews.text: XL thin crust pizza was perfect. Rib tips were great as well. Glad they're open again.

detailedReviews.author: Tina Igbinosa
detailedReviews.text: Pick up‚ÄîExcellent pizza ! Great service

detailedReviews.author: Michael Murray
detailedReviews.text: Tried to order pizza online, no matter what combination you try you get an error. Tried to call, no one answers. Shame on us trying to support a neighborhood restaurant, they don't want your business.

detailedReviews.author: Cris
detailedReviews.text: The pizza I had it tasted amazing. It feels like home made food!! And it has been nothing but a pleasure to dine here!!

detailedReviews.author: Douglas Striker
detailedReviews.text: Great pizza.

detailedReviews.author: Will O'Reilly
detailedReviews.text:
I was disappointed with my recent visit to this restaurant. Despite the high ratings, it seems those reviews might be biased or written by friends of the owners. The service was lacking, especially considering I was the only customer in the restaurant at the time.

The payment system raised some concerns, and the responses to negative reviews from the restaurant's management did not inspire confidence. Their suggestion that asking for a menu is a "secret" is puzzling and not helpful.

Additionally, while they advertise themselves as a carryout restaurant, the large dining room seems to contradict that claim. It feels like they‚Äôre trying to downplay the lack of dine-in customers.

I anticipate that this review will receive a defense response because whoever replies to this has no experience with customer relations. Just remember the customer is always right not what you think is right. The one good thing about this restaurant is that there is always parking because no one eats here. Or just use the parking lot to park and go somewhere else.

detailedReviews.author: Cleo Flowers
detailedReviews.text: I ordered takeout.  They're thin crust is so delicious üòã

detailedReviews.author: Big Helpers Inc
detailedReviews.text:
Same name but not the same dining in experience/owner. I came in last week around 5:30pm on Monday and the place was empty. (I didn't even hear noise from the kitchen). No one was there to greet us, after a few minutes, a guy came out of the bathroom and asked if we are dining in or taking out. We said dining in and he said we can sit anywhere. He then asked if I knew how to use a QR code and I said yes. He said the water station is over there and you can help yourself. We sat down and my partner went to get water. The water had floating particles in it, and it wasn't the lemon water either. After that, we decided to leave and left a $5 tip. Now here is what we experienced.

1. Walked in and it smelled like old funky musty mopping water
2. No one in front to greet guests
3. Self Service: sit yourself, get your own water, get your plates and utensils.
4. Water had particles floating in it.
5. Scan QR Code, Pre-pay for your meal, 18% gratuity charge for self service.
6. No music, unwelcoming, smelly, must pre-pay and over priced for self service.

Maybe delivery is the way to go as this seems to be a common issue here.

Tip: If people come to Leonas, they want the old Leonas experience. Not a watered down App ordering self service experience like McDonalds.

detailedReviews.author: Anais Rivera
detailedReviews.text: Delivery driver was great with the hand off handled the food with care. And food was great and hot‚Ä¶

detailedReviews.author: Myisha D. Hall
detailedReviews.text:
Leona's pizzeria food quality is consistently outstanding, exceeding my expectations every time. Outstanding Professionalism and customer services!
- Hinshaw Law Hospitality Lead

detailedReviews.author: Donna Ippolito
detailedReviews.text: Love this restaurant. Traditional Italian food (not unrecognizable upscale stuff), friendly service, down-home ambience, and great prices. I recommend the place often and go there whenever I have a chance.

detailedReviews.author: Cyd Bloom.
detailedReviews.text: 3 friends, 3 whole slab of ribs, 3 happy people. The ribs were delicious and very meaty. The service was great and Kathy, our server, couldnt  have been nicer.

detailedReviews.author: Ben Krause
detailedReviews.text: Amazing salads. Amazing pizza. Homemade fresh croutons. Homemade ranch. Fresh tomatoes. Nothing beats the summer than a delicious salad from Leona‚Äôs.

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers have positive experiences overall. Your 4.3/5 rating from 100 recent reviews shows solid satisfaction with room for growth.

strengthsPerceived: Customers love the friendly and engaged staff who go above and beyond, even offering complimentary pizza during special occasions - social media marketing can showcase this strength

The delicious and authentic taste of the pizza and other menu items, such as the Sicilian style pizza and wedge fries, consistently impresses customers - SEO services can leverage this for better visibility
The owner‚Äôs personal engagement with customers and sharing of the restaurant's history creates a unique and memorable dining experience - review management can highlight this positive aspect
improvementOpportunities: Negative reviews and reputation issues, including complaints about false advertising and poor service - review management can address this concern
Poor online visibility and incorrect information on the website, such as outdated promotions and incorrect operating hours - SEO services can solve this visibility issue
Lack of atmosphere and ambiance awareness, with customers noting issues like closed dining areas and an unwelcoming environment - social media marketing can improve this area

positive.author: SHERRY MARKS
positive.text: Great pizza friendly staff, close to my home, will definitely be going back.

neutral.author: Doe
neutral.text: Average. Wasn't expecting much so I wasn't too disappointed. My main disappointment was for the pizza toppings. Did a thin half/half and toppings for half the pizza costs the same as the whole pizza. You'd think that meant they would do a lot more topping but no, it's the average amount of toppings. What was NOT average was the pathetic amount of spinach I got in my stuffed pizza. There was almost nothing in there.

neutral.author: Anonymoose
neutral.text: I think Old Irving needed a quick pizza/pasta place like this. I tried a sausage thin crust, spaghetti with meat sauce, and a Detroit style with pepperoni. Personally, I wouldn‚Äôt order the Detroit style again. The edges were crispy, but it was just okay. The spaghetti and meat sauce were good, but it‚Äôs spaghetti and meat sauce so don‚Äôt expect anything crazy. The winner was the sausage thin crust. It wasn‚Äôt too cheesy, which is what I like, and the crust was a great mix between crispy and easy to chew. The amount of sauce was perfect. Not too little (like some places), but enough to actually taste it. I know some other reviews from here say to avoid toppings, but I thought the sausage was good. I will definitely get the thin crust again.

neutral.author: Guido Medina
neutral.text: Ordered a pizza this past weekend.  Not bad but found it lacking in taste, sauce tasted like it was straight out the can. I also ordered some calamari but unfortunately it was very rubbery and uneatable so I had to throw it away.  Hoping this place gets better as I was a fan of this place.

negative.author: Maya Papaya
negative.text: I would not recommend. I ordered a fish plater and It so fishy tasting to the point where I couldn‚Äôt even swallow it let alone finish the food I payed for. Everything else was tasteless and my garlic bread was stale. The service was sub par. I called and emailed for assistance to no response. Food and service was less than good.

negative.author: Eva Gelfand
negative.text:
The Old Irving Park Leona's location took over the Tahina Kitchen space. Shifting from an incredible Middle Eastern, quality food and service restaurant, to a sub-par pizza place, absolutely Unworthy of the long standing Leona's name and reputation. Overall experience: Horrible. I just raised my cholesterol numbers for REALLY BAD food.

I was very hopeful for the new Old Irving Park location, as I grew up eating at various Leona's in Chicago. I placed an order today as a treat for myself and a break from my healthy eating pattern.  Before I could do so, a pop up for "Club Rewards" popped up, so I entered my phone number and immediately saw a "Free Cheese Pizza" for signing up. However,  when I picked up my order from the rude guy behind the register, I showed him the pop up and explained I tried to enter the code and it wouldn't work. He quickly said "we aren't doing that anymore, too many people kept clicking on it..." I told him they needed to take it off their website, as that is false advertising. He did not respond.  Not "I'm  sorry about that," or "I'll let my boss know." No response, he just stood there staring at me.

I ordered the Italian Beef Egg Rolls and Brick Mozzarella Sticks. The Brick Mozzarella sticks were incredible growing up, the ones I got today, were inedible. The batter used for the outside reminded me of a hard, tasteless, corn flake. I have no idea what they are using now, but the outside of the Mozzarella Brick was bizarre, the texture was really unpleasant, I'm surprised I didn't chip a tooth. The Italian Beef Egg Rolls (2 in the order what??) Were also unpleasant as one of them was burned. Flavor was lacking.

Other reviewers have also had similar experiences here. My guess is this Leona's location won't last long. Its too bad, they used to have good food and service. I won't be going back.

negative.author: Carla
negative.text: This is not a Leonas. It's a Romas fast food place. Went there for nothing.
